intro: Ada andreettae, commonly known as the Andreetta's adenophora, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
